name: quasarrat

procedures: T1005::[QuasarRAT] can retrieve files from compromised client machines.

T1016::[QuasarRAT] has the ability to enumerate the Wide Area Network (WAN) IP through requests to ip-api[.]com, freegeoip[.]net, or api[.]ipify[.]org observed with user-agent string `Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; rv:48.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/48.0`.
T1021.001::[QuasarRAT] has a module for performing remote desktop access.
T1033::[QuasarRAT] can enumerate the username and account type.
T1053.005::[QuasarRAT] contains a .NET wrapper DLL for creating and managing scheduled tasks for maintaining persistence upon reboot.
T1056.001::[QuasarRAT] has a built-in keylogger.
T1059.003::[QuasarRAT] can launch a remote shell to execute commands on the victim’s machine.
T1082::[QuasarRAT] can gather system information from the victim’s machine including the OS type.
T1090::[QuasarRAT] can communicate over a reverse proxy using SOCKS5.
T1095::[QuasarRAT] can use TCP for C2 communication.
T1105::[QuasarRAT] can download files to the victim’s machine and execute them.
T1112::[QuasarRAT] has a command to edit the Registry on the victim’s machine.
T1125::[QuasarRAT] can perform webcam viewing.
T1547.001::If the [QuasarRAT] client process does not have administrator privileges it will add a registry key to `HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run` for persistence.
T1548.002::[QuasarRAT] can generate a UAC pop-up Window to prompt the target user to run a command as the administrator.
T1552.001::[QuasarRAT] can obtain passwords from FTP clients.
T1553.002::A [QuasarRAT] .dll file is digitally signed by a certificate from AirVPN.
T1555.003::[QuasarRAT] can obtain passwords from common web browsers.
T1555::[QuasarRAT] can obtain passwords from common FTP clients.
T1564.001::[QuasarRAT] has the ability to set file attributes to "hidden" to hide files from the compromised user's view in Windows File Explorer.

T1564.003::[QuasarRAT] can hide process windows and make web requests invisible to the compromised user. Requests marked as invisible have been sent with user-agent string `Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_3) AppleWebKit/537.75.14 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/7.0.3 Safari/7046A194A` though [QuasarRAT] can only be run on Windows systems.
T1571::[QuasarRAT] can use port 4782 on the compromised host for TCP callbacks.
T1573.001::[QuasarRAT] uses AES with a hardcoded pre-shared key to encrypt network communication.
T1614::[QuasarRAT] can determine the country a victim host is located in.

description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) is an open-source, remote access tool that has been publicly available on GitHub since at least 2014. [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) is developed in the C# language.(Citation: GitHub QuasarRAT)(Citation: Volexity Patchwork June 2018)
